alert.note: Alert for Custer; Lincoln (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 7:30AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Lincoln and southwestern Custer Counties through 800 AM CDT... At 729 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles south of Maxwell, or 17 miles north of Curtis, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Brady, Maxwell, Keith, Jeffrey Canyon State Wildlife Management Area, Cottonwood Canyon State Wildlife Management Area and Etna. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 186 and 204. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
